alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 9:23AM EST until January 13 at 5:22PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Jones, Monroe, Houston, Twiggs and Bibb Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding continues. The Macon Greenway Ocmulgee Heritage Trail will begin to flood in areas just north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The public should not use this portion of the trail. In addition...the lowest sections of the Charles Jones Gateway Park will flood. Portions of agricultural lands well downstream will be under two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 18.5 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM EST Saturday was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 12.8 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/12/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM EST.
